metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10396 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The racoon daemon in IPsec-Tools 0.8.2 contains a remotely exploitable computational-complexity attack when parsing and storing ISAKMP fragments. The implementation permits a remote attacker to exhaust computational resources on the remote endpoint by repeatedly sending ISAKMP fragment packets in a particular order such that the worst-case computational complexity is realized in the algorithm utilized to determine if reassembly of the fragments can take place.

criterions.comment: ipsec-tools: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
